Key Match Events: Nitish Reddy scored a maiden half-century in 26 balls with seven sixes and four fours
Rinku Singh played a rescuing hand with 53 off 29 balls
India scored a tall 221-9 in 20 overs
Bangladesh was restricted to 135-9 in 20 overs
Post-Match Reflections: Nitish Reddy expressed pride in representing India and credited the captain and coach for giving him the license to play his shots
Miscellaneous Highlights: India had won the first T20 in Gwalior by seven wickets
The third and final T20 will be played in Hyderabad on Saturday
Others: India struggled to get going initially with Sanju Samson failing once again – out for 10
Big hitting Abhishek Sharma (15) and skipper Suryakumar Yadav (8) were back in the hut cheaply
India scored 120 runs in the final 10 overs and posted the second highest T20 total against Bangladesh – behind South Africa’s 224-4 in 2017
Seven Indian bowlers picked up wickets, with Reddy and Chakravarthy leading the way
Bangladesh was down to 46-4 in 6.5 overs
Only five of its batters reached double figures and Mahmudullah top scored with 41 off 39 balls to save his side embarrassment
The second-best score was 16 by Emon, and by Mehidy Hasan Miraz in the middle order, outlining why the visitors never stood a chance in this tall chase
